meanings.definition: A substance that promotes bowel movements.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed a laxative to help with constipation.
meanings.sent2: She took a laxative to relieve her stomach discomfort.
meanings.sent3: After eating too much cheese, he jokingly said he needed a laxative to move things along.
meanings.sent4: The new diet plan acted as a laxative for her sluggish digestion.
meanings.sent5: The laxative worked like a charm, clearing out her system in no time.

meanings.sent1: The laxative effect of the medicine helped regulate his digestion.
meanings.sent2: The herbal tea had a laxative property that aided in cleansing the colon.
meanings.sent3: The spicy food had a laxative impact on his stomach, leading to unexpected bathroom trips.
meanings.sent4: The sudden change in diet had a laxative result, surprising her with frequent trips to the restroom.
meanings.sent5: The laxative nature of the fruit juice helped ease his constipation issues.
